parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)

parameters.name: InternalRG
parameters.query:
where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| where id =~  "{Workspace}"
| project resourceGroup

parameters.name: Help
parameters.label: Show Help
parameters.description: This will show some help information to help you understand the page you are on

content.title: Tables and Usage

content.json:
Select the table for which you want to see:
- in which scheduled analytic rule in the {Workspace:label} workspace the specified table is used 
- which saved searches from {Workspace:label} run on the table
- whether a bookmark in {Workspace:label} uses the table
- whether the table was used in queries performed from the portal, workbooks, logic apps, etc in the selected time range

content.title: Tables with activity in the {TimeRange:label}
content.noDataMessage: No tables were used in this period

content.title: Table with only TableName as content
Summary of analytic rules for the {TableName} table
All Analytic rules

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to open query and view additional information

content.title: EventID used in the scheduled analytic rules

content.json:
This view shows you when the EventID condition used in the rule.
It is able to look for "EventID ==" and "EventID in ()"
**Disclaimer**:
* It will only match on the first condition it and will not look for further matches. This means that SecurityEvent | where EventID == 1453 or EventID == 1698` will only match on the first condition.
* It will show the event even if your condition is excluding the event (e.g. `not( not ( where eventId== 1234))`) * If the event is not specified because it is part of a range, the event will not be matched (e.g. event 4625 will not be found if your query is checking for `EventID between (4624 .. 4627)`) **NOTE:** This information group is only visible when you are looking at rules that include the *SecurityEvent* table.

content.title: EventIDs found in all the rules

content.json:
does not work on between values

do not use spaces and one value at a time

also this will also match if you search for 233 and the number is 4233, but not sure if I should fix it since this could actually be usefull

we could show the in between operator as an option? lets discuss during our call

content.json:
This section shows information about templates available for the {TableName} table.
The templates you see below are available for you to create.
You can do this from Analytics > Rule templates. Select the rule you want to deploy and then select Create rule.

content.noDataMessage: Currently there are no templates which use this table

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to open query and view additional information

content.json:
The following section compares your analytics against their templates and it will tell you whether you should check your analytic for updates based on the last time your analytic was edited versus the last modified time of the template.
Select TemplateID on the dropdown to compare analytics against templates based on ID (relevant if you created your analytics directly from the Create button on the templates). You can select Name if you created them from scratch but used the same name from the template.

parameters.name: compare
parameters.label: Compare
parameters.description: Compares your analytics against the templates based on the template ID

content.json: Below you will find all analytics created from templates. Use the Updates column to see if the template has been updated since you lasted edited your analytic.

formatOptions.linkLabel: Click to open query and view additional information

content.json: The following table shows the number of queries or searches that have been performed from different places against your tables in the time range selected at the top.

content.query:
let Tables = Usage| summarize by DataType;
let Rest=dynamic(["ASC_Portal","ASI_Portal","Sentinel-Investigation-Queries","Sentinel-analyticsManagement-customerQuery", "AppInsightsPortalExtension","AzureMonitorLogsConnector","AppAnalytics","IbizaExtension","AzureInformationProtection"]);
LAQueryLogs
| where RequestClientApp in (Rest)
| where QueryText !startswith 'search'
| where QueryText !startswith 'union'
| where QueryText !startswith "top"
| extend thisisnteasy = split(QueryText,' ')
| mv-expand thisisnteasy
| extend Table = tostring(thisisnteasy)
| join kind=leftsemi Tables on $left.Table == $right.DataType
| summarize MSDefenderForCloud = countif(RequestClientApp == "ASC_Portal"), MicrosoftSentinel = countif(RequestClientApp == "ASI_Portal" or RequestClientApp == "Sentinel-Investigation-Queries" or RequestClientApp == "Sentinel-analyticsManagement-customerQuery"), AppInsights = countif(RequestClientApp == "AppInsightsPortalExtension"), LogicApps = countif(RequestClientApp == "AzureMonitorLogsConnector"), LogsUI = countif(RequestClientApp == "AppAnalytics"), AzureDashboard = countif(RequestClientApp == "IbizaExtension"), AIP = countif(RequestClientApp == "AzureInformationProtection"), Other = countif(RequestClientApp !in (Rest)) by Table
content.title: Searches run in {TimeRange:label}
